document.masterDocTitle: Rhyparoclopius aokiae sp. nov., a remarkable Stenopodainae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil, with taxonomical notes on other species of Rhyparoclopius Stål

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rhyparoclopius desiccatus
was described based on a single macropterous female from Cayenne, French Guiana , measuring 22 mm in length (
Amyot & Serville 1843
), which is currently deposited in the Signoret Collection belonging to the Natural History Museum, Vienna, Austria (Naturhistorisches Museum, NHMW ) (
Sehnal 2000
) (
Figs. 39–40
, © by Natural History Vienna, Austria , Hemiptera Image Collection, published with permission, courtesy of Harald Bruckner).

Sehnal ( 2000 )
noted that since the specific name “
dessiccatus
” is grammatically incorrect, Stål (1866 , 1872 ) and
Maldonado ( 1990 )
wrote the name as “
desiccatus
”. However,
Sehnal ( 2000 )
favored the continued usage of the original spelling.

Interestingly, among the labels attached to the holotype , on the one which seems to be the oldest and possibly handwritten by one of the authors of this species, the specific name was spelled “
dessicatus
” (
Fig. 40
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 39–43.
Rhyparoclopius desiccatus
, 39–40, female holotype and labels (© by Natural History Vienna, Austria,
Hemiptera Image
Collection, published with permission, courtesy of Harald Bruckner), 39, dorsal view, 40, labels; 41–43, specimens from Amazonas State, Brazil, 41–42, male, dorsal view, 42, apical portion of hemelytra and abdomen, 43, female, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This is the first record of
R. desiccatus
from Brazil .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 44–51.
Rhyparoclopius desiccatus
, male genitalia, 44–45, eighth sternite and pygophore, 44, ventral view, 45, dorsal view, 46, process of pygophore, dorsal view, 47–48, right paramere, 47, dorsal view, 48, ventral view, 49, phallus, lateral view, 50, articulatory apparatus, dorsal phallotheca plate and struts, dorsal view, 51, apical portion of endosoma with flap-like processes, dorsal view.

Rhyparoclopius desiccatus
(A. & S.)” Wygodzinsky det. [ 19 ] 64 ; male, [ ex ] Coleção Campos Seabra / Tefé,
27- 31 .VII. 1956
, M. Alvarenga legit /
“ Rhyparoclopius desiccatus
(A. e S.)” J.C.M. Carvalho det. 1990 , [ MNRJ ].
